page.title: 10CHURCHES, STRENSHAM AREA.
page.content: There are two churches and a Friends' Meeting House. {Strensham Church}was largely rebuilt in the 14th Century and has six bells.It overlooks the River Avon and is a long way from the village of Strensham. It is noted for its Russell Memorials and brasses. There is a service on the 3rd and 5th Sundays. {Hill Croome Church}has a saddleback tower dating back to the 13th Century. Nearby is a farmhouse with a{dovecote. Services are held twice a month. The Rector of Ripple is responsible for these churches and two other. {The Friends' Meeting House}at Woodmancote, near Defford has been there for 90 years and has a weekly service. Next to the house was a moat which has recently been filled in and is now used as a car park.
